snippet: Even without best sellers on the scale of last year’s Steve Jobs biography, owners of independent bookstores say sales are good, and that Kobo e-readers have been a boon.
abstract: Owners of independent bookstores say that sales are good, even though there has not been a breakout bestseller for the holiday season, and that Kobo e-readers, which are designed to allow customers to buy e-books through independent bookstore's Web sites, have been a boon.
lead_paragraph: Even without best sellers on the scale of last year’s Steve Jobs biography, owners of independent bookstores say sales are good, and that Kobo e-readers have been a boon.

headline.seo: Small Bookstores Say They’re Thriving, Even Without Big Hits
headline.main: No Big Hits, but Bookshops Say They’re Thriving
headline.print_headline: No Big Hits, but Bookshops Say They’re Thriving
